newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Euroclear and Cedel to serve Easdaq.
newsitem.headline: Euroclear and Cedel to serve Easdaq.

text.p: European growth stocks market Easdaq said on Monday Euroclear and Cedel Bank had joined Swiss-based INTERSETTLE as its settlement providers.

Easdaq said in a statement that while INTERSETTLE would continue to handle market settlement, institutional investors and their custodians would be able to choose between keeping their holdings of Easdaq securities with Brussels-based Euroclear and/or Luxembourg-based Cedel Bank.
"The inclusion of Euroclear and Cedel Bank in the list of settlement prociders will enable Easdaq to broaden further its international investor base," it said.
Jacques Putzeys, chief executive officer of Easdaq, said in the statement that the addition of the two new settlement providers would further accelerate the investor-driven growth of the market.
Easdaq was launched last November and now quotes seven stocks. Putzeys said market capitalisation had already passed the $1.4 billion mark.
Easdaq has members in nine European countries and the United States.
